intro: Coccoloba orbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its round, lobed leaves that are often covered in a fine, whitish bloom. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in inflorescences and bloom in the spring. Coccoloba orbicularis is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions.
